item.title: Spotify reveals its list of 25 talented individuals under the age of 25 in Singapore
item.description:
Spotify has unveiled the top 25 most influential artists under 25 who are currently dominating the music scene in Singapore. Shawn Mendes, an 18-year-old singer-songwriter from Canada, takes the top spot. He boasts 25 million monthly listeners on Spotify and over 500 million streams for his hit song, “Stitches.” Following closely behind Mendes are Ariana Grande, Martin Garrix, Justin Bieber, and Alessia Cara. Popular artists Gentle Bones and Fifth Harmony are also included in the list...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/spotify-reveals-its-list-of-25-talented-individuals-under-the-age-of-25-in-singapore/

item.title: Spotify reveals top music of 2014
item.description:
Source: Spotify. Spotify has unveiled its Year in Music, analyzing data from 50 million users and over 7 billion hours of music to determine 2014’s top songs and artists. UK artist Ed Sheeran leads as the most streamed artist globally, with over 860 million streams on Spotify. His album, released in June to critical acclaim, also achieved the highest number of streams, exceeding 430 million. In Singapore, Jay Chou maintains his position as the most streamed Asian artist for the second consecutive year...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/spotify-reveals-top-music-of-2014/

item.title: Throwback Thursday Spotify style with Your Time Capsule
item.description:
Spotify has introduced “Your Time Capsule,” a new personalized playlist that follows the success of their summer playlist, “Your Summer Rewind.” This playlist, available now to Spotify users in 60 markets, curates 30 nostalgic tracks from a user’s teenage and young adult years, offering a musical trip down memory lane. Source: Spotify. Spotify launches Your Time Capsule playlist. To find Your Time Capsule, check the top of the Home section or the Decades section in the Browse area on Spotify’s iOS and Android mobile apps, or visit the playlist online...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/throwback-thursday-spotify-style-with-your-time-capsule/

item.title: Spotify has identified a total of 1,369 musical genres up to this point
item.description:
Spotify uses a music intelligence platform that analyzes music in real time to pinpoint groups of similar sounds, which helps them discover and categorize emerging music genres. Eliot Van Buskirk, Spotify’s Data Storyteller, highlighted in a blog post that this allows Spotify to stay ahead of the curve in identifying new genres as they emerge, ensuring users can discover them quickly. The platform analyzes the listening habits of real music fans to understand how songs and artists are trending within specific genres...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/spotify-has-identified-a-total-of-1-369-musical-genres-up-to-this-point/

item.title: Spotify users in Singapore have collectively spent 11.4 billion minutes on the platform
item.description:
Forty percent of Singaporeans with Internet access use Spotify for their streaming needs. The music streaming service is celebrating its third successful year in Singapore. Since its launch, Spotify has become a favorite way for Singaporeans to enjoy music, according to Sunita Kaur, Spotify Asia’s Managing Director. She believes that Spotify is the ideal music streaming service for Singapore, offering the best local and international music and features. Since Spotify’s Singapore launch, users have spent 11...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/spotify-users-in-singapore-have-collectively-spent-11-4-billion-minutes-on-the-platform/

item.title: Spotify creates playlists for foggy weather
item.description:
Source: Spotify. Spotify has curated a playlist specifically for the hazy conditions currently affecting Singapore and Malaysia. You can listen to the playlist below. Interested in learning more? Stay informed about the hourly air quality readings in Singapore. Read this WorkSmart Asia blog article about Spotify’s mobile-first approach. Hashtag: #SGHaze..

item.title: Exclusive Global Jay Chou content available on Spotify from December 16th to 18th
item.description:
Source: Spotify website. Music streaming platform, Spotify, released Asian pop star Jay Chou’s latest single, “What Kind of Man are You?” today. Spotify is offering fans an early preview of one of the year’s most anticipated albums, with the release of Jay Chou’s latest album, “Aiyo, Not Bad,” planned for December 26th, days before its official release. Recently ranked the most streamed Asian artist on Spotify’s Year in Music charts, Jay Chou is celebrating his return to the pop charts with this new album after a two-year hiatus...

item.title: Prioritizing mobile can lead to success
item.description:
Source: Spotify. Kaur. Spotify’s Asian launch prioritized mobile support, recognizing the region’s growing mobile-centric market, according to Sunita Kaur, Managing Director, Asia, Spotify, speaking at CommunicAsia2015. This mobile-first, freemium approach has significantly expanded Spotify’s user base, leading to a surge in premium subscribers with an average conversion rate of approximately 20%, Kaur explained. “We are fully committed to the freemium mobile model,” Kaur stated. “We share the music labels’ view that subscribers are vital to revitalizing the industry...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/prioritizing-mobile-can-lead-to-success/
